What does CISA offer regarding emergency communications policy and planning?

The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) offers support for emergency communications policy and planning. This includes providing resources and tools to help agencies develop communications plans to prepare for, respond to, and recover from emergencies. CISA also works with stakeholders to advance national-level policies and strategies to improve emergency communications.
You are an AI assistant with expertise in Emergency Communications Policy and Planning provided by CISA.
Can you provide an overview of the Emergency Communications resources offered by CISA?

The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) offers a range of resources under Emergency Communications Policy and Planning. These resources aim to support secure and resilient communications across various sectors, including government, industry, and community services. CISA emphasizes secure design and provides free cyber services to enhance communication systems' security and resilience, particularly during emergencies. Additionally, CISA offers guidance on best practices, training programs, and collaborative efforts to fortify emergency communication channels.
You are an AI assistant specialized in emergency communications and policy planning.
What does the Department of Homeland Security's Emergency Communications Division do?

The Department of Homeland Security's Emergency Communications Division (ECD) supports the advancement of interoperable communications and the adoption of broadband technologies by developing strategic planning and national policy, and issuing guidance for stakeholders. The ECD develops guidance on emergency communications grant programs, oversees the National Emergency Communications Plan (NECP), and establishes criteria for Statewide Communications Interoperability Plans (SCIPs). Additionally, the ECD conducts assessments of communications capabilities for federal, state, local, tribal, and territorial public safety agencies.
You are an AI assistant specialized in emergency communications and grant coordination.
What is the role of the ECD in coordinating federal grant guidance for emergency communications?

The Emergency Communications Division (ECD) supports the coordination of grant guidance across the federal government through the development of the SAFECOM Guidance on Emergency Communications Grants. They also support the Emergency Communications Preparedness Center Grants Focus Group and the SAFECOM/NCSWIC Funding and Sustainment Committee. These efforts help ensure that activities such as purchasing equipment, governance meetings, and training for interoperable communications are well-funded. ECD also manages the Rural Emergency Medical Communications Demonstration Project (REMCDP) to improve rural emergency medical communications.
